Comment: Two recounts affirmed Riggs’ 734-vote margin of victory after the election, but Griffin, an appeals court judge, refused to concede and challenged the eligibility of more than [65,000 voters](https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2024/12/north-carolina-judge-allison-riggs-won-two-recounts-republicans-are-still-trying-to-overturn-her-election/). He presented no evidence of illegal voting, but two GOP-dominated courts in North Carolina—the state of appeals and state Supreme Court—green-lit his scheme to throw out enough votes to potentially [reverse Riggs’ win](https://www.wral.com/story/nc-supreme-court-votes-to-throw-out-some-but-not-all-ballots-contested-in-2024-race-for-seat-on-court/21955935/).

Comment: Same reason they’re so obsessed with changing voter id and registration laws all the time.  It isn’t just about everyone eventually having the right kind of ID or the right documents to register, the introduction of a change in requirements causes a delay where some percentage of people who were going to vote in an election no longer can meet the requirements in time.  It doesn’t matter if 100% of eligible voters eventually get the right ID, because by the time they do so the consequential election,(like 2016, which trashed the Supreme Court) will have already passed, and the change in requirements will have altered the vote totals.
Author: suddenlypandabear
